greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of cyclotomic cosets C of 2 mod 2n+1 such that -C is not equal to C, divided by 2.
reference: F. J. MacWilliams and N. J. A. Sloane, The Theory of Error-Correcting Codes, Elsevier/North Holland, 1977, pp. 104-105.
link: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
example: Mod 15 there are 4 cosets: {1, 2, 4, 8}, {3, 6, 12, 9}, {5, 10}, {7, 14, 13, 11}. Only the cosets {1, 2, 4, 8} and {7, 14, 13, 11} have the desired property, so a(7) = 2/2 = 1.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 25 2001
